TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ArgIterator extends System.ValueType

Docs.summary: Represents a variable-length argument list; that is, the parameters of a function that takes a variable number of arguments.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Developers who write compilers use the <xref:System.ArgIterator> structure to enumerate the mandatory and optional arguments in an argument list. The <xref:System.ArgIterator> structure is not generally useful for applications other than compilers.
The functionality in the <xref:System.ArgIterator> structure is typically hidden in the syntax of a specific programming language. For example, in the C++ programming language you declare a variable-length argument list by specifying an ellipsis ("...") at the end of the argument list. The <xref:System.ArgIterator> structure is useful primarily when a development language does not provide direct support for accessing variable-length parameters.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.RuntimeArgumentHandle arglist) cil managed

Docs.param: An argument list consisting of mandatory and optional arguments.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the structure using the specified argument list.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The new <xref:System.ArgIterator> object enumerates the argument list starting from the first optional argument.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.RuntimeArgumentHandle arglist, void* ptr) cil managed

Docs.param: An argument list consisting of mandatory and optional arguments.
A pointer to the argument in arglist to access first, or the first mandatory argument in arglist if ptr is .
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the structure using the specified argument list and a pointer to an item in the list.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The new <xref:System.ArgIterator> object enumerates the argument list starting from the argument specified by `ptr`, or the first mandatory argument if `ptr` is `null`.

Docs.permission: requires full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted or transparent code.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void End() cil managed

Docs.summary: Concludes processing of the variable-length argument list represented by this instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Conceptually, <xref:System.ArgIterator.End%2A> concludes the processing of a variable-length argument list. However, this method has no actual implementation; the <xref:System.ArgIterator.End%2A> method body is empty. You can use this method in your code as a marker to indicate where variable-length argument list processing logically ends.
The <xref:System.ArgIterator.End%2A> method corresponds to the `va_end` method in the C standard library.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool Equals(object o) cil managed

Docs.param: An object to be compared to this instance.
Docs.summary: This method is not supported, and always throws .
Docs.returns: This comparison is not supported. No value is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 GetHashCode() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the hash code of this object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance valuetype System.TypedReference GetNextArg() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the next argument in a variable-length argument list.
Docs.returns: The next argument as a object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The iterator is automatically advanced to the next argument.

Docs.exception: An attempt was made to read beyond the end of the list.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance valuetype System.TypedReference GetNextArg(valuetype System.RuntimeTypeHandle rth) cil managed

Docs.param: A runtime type handle that identifies the type of the argument to retrieve.
Docs.summary: Returns the next argument in a variable-length argument list that has a specified type.
Docs.returns: The next argument as a object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The iterator is automatically advanced to the next argument.

Docs.exception: An attempt was made to read beyond the end of the list.
The pointer to the remaining arguments is zero.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance valuetype System.RuntimeTypeHandle GetNextArgType() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the type of the next argument.
Docs.returns: The type of the next argument.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method does not advance the iterator to the next argument.
<xref:System.ArgIterator.GetNextArgType%2A> returns the type of the argument as specified in the calling function. For example, if an argument is type <xref:System.String>, but the calling function specifies the argument as type <xref:System.Object>, <xref:System.ArgIterator.GetNextArgType%2A> reports the argument as type <xref:System.Object>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int32 GetRemainingCount() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the number of arguments remaining in the argument list.
